intro: Chamaesyce halemanui, commonly known as Halemanu weed, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green, leaf-like structures called phyllodes. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in small inflorescences. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its invasive nature, it is considered a noxious weed in its native range.
